intro: Lipochaeta integrifolia, commonly known as the smoothleaf lipochaeta, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal regions and has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Lipochaeta integrifolia is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and adaptability to sandy soils.
